subject: Fashion
title: Ralph Lauren's American Dream
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Ralph Lauren's American Dream.

hook.text: Ralph Lauren grew up poor in the Bronx. He built a billion-dollar brand selling an American fantasy.

buildup.text: He never went to fashion school. He started by selling wide ties from a small drawer in a showroom.

discovery.text: Lauren didn't design clothesâ€”he designed a lifestyle. Polo ads showed mansions, horses, and yachts.

twist.text: Customers weren't buying fabric. They were buying the dream of a life they'd probably never live.

climax.text: Ralph Lauren proved that fashion sells stories, not stitches. The brand is the product.

punchline.text: He sold America an image of itselfâ€”and America bought it.

quiz.question: What was Ralph Lauren really selling through his brand?
options: A lifestyle and aspirational American dream, not just clothing
European luxury fashion adapted for the U.S. market
